name: Dhis2-hii
tagline: Health infrastructures information app for DHIS2
body:
### The project:

This project has the objective to offer a simple and intuitive way of reporting the state of health infrastructutes of a region, managing the information of the infrastructural state of the building and its inventory with periodical reports. This application will run on the information system [https://www.dhis2.org/](DHIS2) and our main goal is to provide a complete integration with an existing DHIS2 infrastructure, and making a solution where the user doesn't have to configure anything to make it work.

This project is currently on development and a first v1.0 version is scheduled for the end of December of 2014.

### Demo:

We have set up a proof of concept demo [here](https://dps-inhambane.asfes.org) where you can check the Dhis2-hii app.

Log in with: hii.user / DemoUser2015

### Download:

DHIS2-hii is open source software licensed under the liberal BSD license and is free for everyone to install and use. The DHIS2-hii code is  provided "as is". You can download the dhis2-hii repository as a .zip, and install it on DHIS2. 


### Developers and collaborators:

This application is being Coordinated by the ONG [Arquitectos Sin Fronteras](http://asfes.org/), and developed by the [Facultat d'Informàtica de Barcelona](http://www.fib.upc.edu/fib.html) and [Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya](http://www.upc.edu/), with the funding of [Agència Catalana de Cooperació al Desenvolupament](http://cooperaciocatalana.gencat.cat/ca/) of the Government of Catalonia and [Centre de Coperació per al Desenvolupament - UPC](http://www.upc.edu/ccd), with the fully and grateful colaboration of the Healh Ministry of the Republic of Mozambique and the Direcçao Provincial de Saúd de Inhambane.


![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Samitier/images/master/logos2.png)

### Contact:
Gorka Solana (Project Manager) @ASF-inhambane

Blai Samitier (developer) @Samitier
